Evaluation:   WHERE v WHEN

This is tricky example of when x in the call:  f(x <- 12)  is evaluated.

Compare `=` and `<-` in a function

```r
rm(list = ls())

f  <- function(x) x

f(x=20)
x  # error

# this evaluates in the caller env (global)
f(x  <- 10)
x
```

as suggested
```r
rm(list = ls())

do.nothing <- function(x) {
  # x isn't evaluated
  42
}

# x is forced
do.something <- function(x) {
  force(x)
  42
  }


do.nothing()   #  42   no error!
do.nothing(x = 12) #  42

# But this a suprise
# not expected !
do.nothing( x <- 12 )      # 42
x                          # Error: object 'x' not found

# fixed
do.somethng( x <- 12 )    # 42
x                         # 12
